main.name: Christopher Look
main.description: I love designing and implementing effective and maintainable solutions
main.bio: I love solving technical problems. I believe just about all the easy problems have been solved, and so the only valuable problems left to solve are hard. I have led a team of 4 engineers to create an EEG device to Diagnose Alzheimer's with Machine Learning. I designed a trading algorithm that traded based on twitter data and traded my real money. I'm looking forward to joining a company to learn more and bring solutions to scale.
main.contactmessage: If you want to contact me I check my email often.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

work.title: Software Development Intern
work.description:
Designed system to automatically predict when API customers would get throttled.
Reduced firefighting in AWS by proactively alerting at-risk customers and preventing service outages before they occured. Implemented in Python and unit tested with mock and pytest.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Created fullstack dashboard to help developers keep track of tickets, code reviews, and builds.  Linked different sources of information to create holistic view of developer workflow. Used MVC model with .NET backend and ReactJS frontend. Led direction of project by conducting interviews with future consumers, and consulting with mentor.

work.title: Research assistant
work.description: Aided in elucidation of mechanism behind allosteric interaction, often called the second secret of life. Used network and graph analysis to identify critical amino acids to target in drug discovery.

work.title: Research Intern
work.description: Created machine learning models to predict whether small molecules would fit in a protein based on chemical descriptors. Developed an NLP Method of predicting whether proteins would interact with each other and prevent drug-drug interactions.

projects.title: Synapto
projects.category: An EEG and machine learning device to diagnose Alzheimers disease. Raised over $40,000, featured in Forbes, Washingtonian, and more.

projects.title: Senvision
projects.category: A trading algorithm based on NLP on twitter to help millennials invest. Made over 2x the market over 5 months.

projects.title: Dart at the Globe
projects.category: A react project to choose a random spot on land for people to vacaction to.

projects.title: Sunrise
projects.category: Chrome Extension to use NLP on text messages to automatically monitor patient health. Compass Challenge Winner

projects.title: Telemonitor Parkinsons
projects.category: Android application to telemonitor severity of parkinson symptoms in response to drugs. Blue Cross Blue Shield Winner
